799896885725200384.text: Without a doubt the best moment in the match so far! #CarlsenKarjakin #Helicopter https://t.co/WphlHbTGQm

800779598246150144.text: Don't dispair chess fans! Despite the slow build-up of today's game, the Colle contains a lot of underlying dynamism. #CarlsenKarjakin

800782109539500032.text: Wondering what makes Sergey delay the development of his b8-knight. Perhaps he is playing with the idea to go Ba6!? #CarlsenKarjakin

800791771613720576.text: Am a bit surprised with how fast the central tension got released. Can Magnus anyway claim a small pull now after 14.Nd4? #CarlsenKarjakin

800794365966680064.text: 14...Rfd8 followed by Nf8-g6 looks very classy. I think Sergey is close to full equality. #CarlsenKarjakin

800798034166693889.text: 17.Qe1!? eyeing the b4-square and preparing to meet Ng6-h4 with Bf1. Aesthetically pleasing! #CarlsenKarjakin

800808006518611968.text: Perhaps Sergey was bothered by 19...Qg5 20.Nbd6, though black has various good ways there. #CarlsenKarjakin

800808873225551872.text: 20...Rxd1 21.Rxd1 Qg5 is still an option. For instance 22.Na7 Nh4 23.f4! Qh5! with fire on the board. #CarlsenKarjakin

800810082325827584.text: @GerbenTieben After Qh4 h3, the knight doesn't have a good retreat square. With queen on g5 it will jump to e5.

800810524250411008.text: @jonathanddownie Carlsen is trying very hard to keep the game alive (19.Nb5) which could give rise to chances for both sides.

800811407776227328.text: @GerbenTieben Exactly! Also note the threatened check on f3.

800814037088997381.text: @GerbenTieben Because 20...Qg5 21.h3 N4e5 22.Nxe5 Nxe5 23.Bxe5 Qxe5 24.Na7! was winning (back rank issues).

800818999298768896.text: Magnus slowly turning this into a game with two possible results. I like Caruana's suggestion of recapturing 23.exd4!? #CarlsenKarjakin

801511004999974916.text: Magnus improved on the recent Nakamura-Kasimdzhanov game and I'm expecting 23...Qd7 now with decent compensation. #CarlsenKarjakin

801514998484914176.text: This may be a slightly surpising comment given its move 23, but I'm surprised Carlsen seems out of book at this point. #CarlsenKarjakin

801517067656658945.text: @chessnotes It's a huge battleground indeed, but the line has an OK reputation.

801523588218109952.text: Instead of 25.Rg4, I thought 25.Bc4 Bxd4 26.Bg5 g6!? or 25.Rg5 Qh3 26.Bxf7+!? where interesting directions. #CarlsenKarjakin

801530201041698816.text: Not sure how much it is, but Sergey certainly has a riskfree and slightly better position after, say, 29.Qd3. #CarlsenKarjakin

801531182068416512.text: With the rook swinging over to g1 and bishop to g5/h6 this could get nasty very fast. #CarlsenKarjakin

801531508292984832.text: @Jonathan_Rowson @chess24com I'm afraid of some slow attack, rook swinging over to g1, bishop to g5/h6 getting to the king.

801533153601064960.text: 30.Bxd5 Qxd5 31.Bf4 Rb7 32.Qe4!? is an option as well. Nasty pin on the b-file after 32...Qxe4 33.fxe4 Rxd4 34.Rh3 #CarlsenKarjakin

801538493289795584.text: @Jonathan_Rowson I like to start with 31.Rh5!? Qe6 but not easy to up the pressure, for instance 32.Rgg5 f5! #CarlsenKarjakin

801540160533987328.text: Perhaps Karjakin spend those 20 minutes calculating 32.Qc4 Rb5 33.Ba4 Qf5! here!? #CarlsenKarjakin

801540944055123968.text: In fact 32.Qc4 Rb5 33.Ba4 Qf5! 34.Qf1! Rb1! 35.Qxb1 Qxf3 36.Rg2 Nc3 37.Qf1 Nxa4 would be fantastic to see on the board! #CarlsenKarjakin

801542561311707136.text: After 33.Ba4 Qf5, the move 34.Qf1! is superhuman. Would be extremely impressive if Karjakin found this. #CarlsenKarjakin

801547430147870720.text: 33...Ra8 is a draw offer: 34.Ba4 Rxa4 35.Qxa4 Qf5! 36.Qxb5 Qxf3 37.Rg2 Qd1 is a perpetual. 34.Bc4!? is a way to continue. #CarlsenKarjakin

801549776978407424.text: Now 35.Bd2 Ra1 36.Rxa1 Rxa1+ 37.Kg2 is already a very substantial advantage. We are in for a treat! #CarlsenKarjakin

801554606660657152.text: 39.Bxf7+!? Kxf7 40.Qc4 Kg7 41.d5! is also not exactly a picknick. Huge moment in the match! #CarlsenKarjakin

801556177729519616.text: @Cliserisa 40...Nd5 41.Rxh7 loses the queen and 40...Qd5 41.Qxc7 is winning too.

801560365024890887.text: 39.Bxf7 Kxf7 40.Qc4 played! The most practical choice I believe. #CarlsenKarjakin

801561240925589504.text: Now one big question is how the endgame is after 41...Nf5 42.Bc3 Kf8 43.Bxa1 Nxh4 44.Qxh4 Qxd5 45.Qf6+ #CarlsenKarjakin

801561930838265866.text: The other option is 41...g5 42.Bc3+ Kg6 43.Re4 Nxd5 44.Bxa1 Nf4+ 45.Rxf4 Bxf4 with some endgame suffering ahead. #CarlsenKarjakin

801563010389200900.text: @Pulitologu Yes, white's only chance is to keep the queens on. Something like Qh8+ Qg8 Qd4!?

801566560397705216.text: Also 45.Qf6+ Qf7 46.Qh8+ Qg8 47.Qd4!? Qf7 48.Bc3 is still a bit of a torture. #CarlsenKarjakin

801870190610907136.text: Liking Carlsen's opening play here! Now 12...f5 13.g3 Nh3+ 14.Kg2 fe 15.de is a fighting position. #CarlsenKarjakin

801873498104795136.text: I like white after 13.g3 Nh3 14.Kg2. Magnus really getting the type of game he was looking for. #CarlsenKarjakin

801875946919882753.text: @viditchess But 15.Nxg5 Qxg5 16.h4!? or 16.Nd5 Qd8 17.f4!? looks a bit better I think.

801884832435421184.text: Sergey has the supersharp option 15...g5!? following it up with Kh8, Qg6 and a slow attack. Not expecting that though :) #CarlsenKarjakin

801886236642279430.text: @luart12 Hence my expectations :) Perhaps he will just go 15...c6.

801888072765997056.text: Given that Karjakin is spending almost half an hour here already, I expect a big decision rather then a neutral move. #CarlsenKarjakin

801892018645508100.text: Is Sergey planning to push 16...d5 here? Seems to work tactically after 17.ed cd 18.Nxd5 Nxd5 19.Bxd5 Rd8! 19.Be4 Bg4! #CarlsenKarjakin

801899476109656064.text: Critical moment! 20.Nd2 Nxf2+ 21.Kg2 is possible here, because of 21...Nh4! 22.gxh4 Qg6! Instead 19.Nd2 looked strong. #CarlsenKarjakin

801901217794424832.text: Wondering if 20.Nd2 Nxf2 21.Kg1!? Nh3+ 22.Kg2 Nhf4 23.gxf4 Nxf4 24.Rxf4 exf4 25.Nc2 is a way to continue the game. #CarlsenKarjakin

801901976602734592.text: @twaburov Agreed! Kind of like the knights there. #CarlsenKarjakin

801906134932226049.text: We will soon see the two players in their element. Magnus pressing a better endgame, Karjakin defending it. #CarlsenKarjakin

801908459180531712.text: Isn't 26...Raf8 27.Re2 dxe4 28.dxe4 Nf4! an issue now? #CarlsenKarjakin

801913739897356294.text: Black would be very happy to get Nh8-f7 in. Not sure he has the time though. #CarlsenKarjakin

801928904319651840.text: @Jonathan_Rowson Thats what I thought as well, I like these knights! Endgame after 24...Qxf4 25.Qf3 also doesnt look clear.

804074343462555648.text: What an amazing defensive effort! Respect. #CarlsenKarjakin

208330700313731075.text: Because, fischerandom chess, imho, is the future...mark my words.

799317393537462272.text: My predictions for game 5: Carlsen finally breaks through in main line Berlin #CarlsenKarjakin                https://t.co/7VeLDJWDpp

799371677071183873.text: 19 Bxc4 in G4 was chess error; 20...Bxc5 in G5 not bad chess-wise, but psychological concession by Karjakin. 2 result game #CarlsenKarjakin

799390305308983296.text: @GMjtis Agreed, may be a sign of frustration from the missed chances in games 3 and 4. Dangerous attitude, usually good at keeping control.

799393591089135616.text: @GMjtis Thinking of Carlsen's boxing metaphor before the match the risk of a chess version of Ali's rope-a-dope strategy by SK comes to mind

799719192005967872.text: Important game for the match. If Karjakin is unable to gain adv. in a theoretical battle as White, Carlsen's chances rise #CarlsenKarjakin

800329109276459009.text: The right spirit for a young player to reject a draw offer - even when it comes from Karpov! https://t.co/nZ4plkOvR2

800432857009229824.text: Strange play from both players. From slightly better to slightly worse for Carlsen. Should still be drawish, though. #CarlsenKarjakin

800434389930938368.text: @Redmonkeybearoo Probably, but easier to achieve with a slight advantage rather than being slightly worse. 16...Rc8 really strange.

800442258260639749.text: No matter who you root for, you would want the challenger to have to show more to potentially win a game. Not an easy hold. #CarlsenKarjakin

800826381684899840.text: I will comment on ICC for Game 9, but I have a hard time explaining some of the moves played in this match - like 24 bxc4. #CarlsenKarjakin

800875825772040192.text: Costly misjudgments by Carlsen; great resourcefulness by Karjakin. Still lots of chess to be played, though. Far from over #CarlsenKarjakin

800881342720438272.text: @davelerner Yes, MC has clearly not been at his best. No need for such reckless play today. But would be stunned if he doesn't win a game.

801039355779358724.text: Lasker (5 games to go), Botvinnik(2), Kasparov(1), Kramnik(6) & Anand(5) all overcame deficits w/ few games left. Will MC? #CarlsenKarjakin

801430529686077440.text: @chvsanchez Of course several, like Alekhine vs. Euwe or Karpov vs. Kasparov. Point is just that it can and has been done. Match still open.

801431577947439104.text: I will be commentating live on @ChessICC from G/9 today with GM Danny King. Don't expect Carlsen to go all out today, but predict long game.

801903356038041601.text: Don't know what is most shocking, 19 Bxe6 or 20...d5. Both hard to understand given the match and time situation. Tension! #CarlsenKarjakin

801906657840205824.text: Back to normal - Carlsen gets a pleasant endgame with the better pawn structure. Another tough defense ahead for Karjakin. #CarlsenKarjakin

801914320871419905.text: By bringing his King to the center, Karjakin covers the weak e-pawns, but may make the Black King a potential target. #CarlsenKarjakin

802173885177352193.text: Not a perfect game, but Carlsen shows the resolve of champions to win G/10 vs Karjakin to even the score. Wide open match. #CarlsenKarjakin
